author: Lego_fan_
title: A must have!
review:
Lego set #853865 is the perfect edition to any Lego Movie of Lego movie 2 collection.

This set includes two Minifigures; Emmet, and Sharkira, two sewer babies, and a falling apart car.

Emmet is the normal Lego movie 2 Apocalypseburg Minifigure. 

Sharkira is exclusive to this set and has some cool print detail such as a chain, and gear belt.

The sewer babies are super cute and are seem to fit in right with their fellow Apocalypseburg citizens. 

The run down car is super cool. It contains an antenna, a whell without the tire, a cross bow turret gun on top, and a crunched end as if a vehichle drove through it. 

Overall i think that this set is super fun and is a must have for any fan of the Lego movie 2.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Could have Been Better.
review:
Set #853865 The LEGO Movie 2 Accessory Set: This set is extremely limited in availability and model build, so why is it worth getting? Well, there are a fair number of decent Minifigures in it. So to speak.

Packaging & Parts

I will combine this discussion because it is an Accessory Set, as with most of these sets it is packaged on a card with blister bubble. This is the older style of card, using a simple image of Apocalypseberg in the background and showing the set off on the back it’s a really generic looking card.

As far as the parts are concerned you don’t get a whole lot, roughly the number you’d find in a Polybag, but it is a fun little model.

Minifigures

Emmet: This version of Emmet is found in 8 sets total, the print and detail is the same as we’ve seen before with the nervous frightened expression and the smiling expression on the opposite side. He includes no accessories.

Sewer Baby: As with the Sparkle Babies these little dudes are sharing parts. Printing is different between them, both are dressed in tattered brown baby outfits, but one has freckles and a gap-toothed grin while the other has a band over his or her eyes which matches the detailing on Sharkira.

Sharkira: This member of MetalBeard’s crew has decked herself out in a load of armour, her print shows gears and metal plates taken from a vehicle or some sort to deck herself out in the post-apocalypse looking outfit. She even has two distinct legs, one regular looking with gear and belt pouch detailing while the other seems to have been replaced with a metal leg of some sort.

The build & completed model

The model included in this set looks like the front end of a car which has been torn apart in the battle for Bricksburg. It includes front grille detailing and a single hubcap, attached to it is a bowcaster stud launcher and features something that may be a window wiper or a radio antenna. It is built out of fairly common elements and looks great, for an accessory set. Most of the Minifigures can fit on it, but it is a bit of a tight fit for all four of them.

Overall opinion

This is a pretty decent accessory set, it compliments the Welcome to Apocaypseburg set quite well and I would suggest getting this alongside with that massive set to add to the display and characters in that set. I’d recommend it, but I would also recommend trying to get it at a discount. The piece count is a bit high for 17$ CND after all. Recommended.
